Package org.ddolib.examples.misp

package org.ddolib.examples.misp
This package implements the acs, astar and ddo models for the Maximum Independent Set Problem (MISP). Given a weighted graph ğº = (ğ‘‰,ğ¸,ğ‘¤) where ğ‘‰= {1,...,ğ‘›} is a set of vertices, ğ¸ \subset ğ‘‰ Ã—ğ‘‰ the set of edges connecting those vertices and ğ‘¤ = {ğ‘¤1,ğ‘¤2,...,ğ‘¤ğ‘›} is a set of weights s.t. ğ‘¤ğ‘– is the weight of node ğ‘–. The problem consists in finding a subset of vertices in a graph such that no edge exists in the graph that connects two of the selected nodes and the sum of the weight of the selected nodes is maximal.
  • David Bergman et al. Decision Diagrams for Optimization. Ed. by Barry Oâ€™Sullivan and Michael Wooldridge. Springer, 2016.
  • David Bergman et al. â€œDiscrete Optimization with Decision Diagramsâ€. In: INFORMS Journal on Computing 28.1 (2016), pp. 47â€“66.
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    org.ddolib.examples
    Package containing examples
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    MispAcsMain
    The Maximum Independent Set Problem (MISP) with Acs.
    MispAstarMain
    The Maximum Independent Set Problem (MISP) with AsTar.
    MispDdoMain
    The Maximum Independent Set Problem (MISP) with Ddo.
    MispDominance
    Implementation of a dominance relation for the Maximum Independent Set Problem (MISP).
    MispFastLowerBound
    Computes a fast lower bound for the Maximum Independent Set Problem (MISP).
    MispGenerator
    Contains methods to generate instances of the MISP.
    MispProblem
    Represents an instance of the Maximum Independent Set Problem (MISP) as a Problem.
    MispRanking
    Implements a ranking strategy for states in the Maximum Independent Set Problem (MISP).
    MispRelax
    Implements a relaxation strategy for the Maximum Independent Set Problem (MISP) to be used in decision diagram optimization (DDO) algorithms.
